columns.text: This item requires us to identify if the term "erosion" defines Porsche's reputation.
The impairment to Porsche's notoriety was undoubtedly why the company had to consider. If the brand growth had suffered, that would have fallen significantly from its existing conventional lines.
In this problem, we will define what erosion is and determine whether it applies to the entry of the company to the SUV market.

Erosion refers to the negative effect a new product or project has to the current revenue of the company. This can occur when the project is of similar nature to an already existing product in the company which may create contention within the products and projects of the company.

In this situation, the concern of the analysts is the late entry of Porsche to the SUV market and that it may destroy the company's reputation of creating fast automobiles. However, based on the data, the Cayenne was a fast SUV that is entering at a competitive price. This means that despite entering later than their competitors, Porsche was still able to produce an automobile that they can sell at a competitive price.

Aside from this, the performance of the Cayenne and its Turbo S variant shows that Porsche is capable of building high-performance SUVs which was what analysts were concerned of.

In this case, the only source of erosion from the entry of Cayenne is the possible diversion of the customers towards this model ultimately decreasing sales of other models. In this case, this can be considered as an erosion but not in the same way as the analysts predicted.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
